required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: CD19 and BCMA Targeted Fast Dual CAR-T for CD19+ Refractory/Relapsed B-NHL
clinical_study.official_title: Exploratory Study to Evaluate Efficacy and Safety of Fast Dual CAR-T Injection in CD19+ Refractory or Relapsed B Cell Non-Hodgkinlymphoma

lead_sponsor.agency: 920th Hospital of Joint Logistics Support Force of People's Liberation Army of China

clinical_study.source: 920th Hospital of Joint Logistics Support Force of People's Liberation Army of China

brief_summary.textblock: This is a single arm, open-label, single-center prospective study to determine the safety and efficacy of Fast Dual CAR-T cells in patients diagnosed with CD19+ refractory/relapsed B cell non-Hodgkinlymphoma (R/R B-NHL).

detailed_description.textblock: The main aim of the study is to determine the safety and efficacy of Fast Dual CAR-T in R/R B-NHL. Fast Dual CAR-T is an autologous dual chimeric antigen receptor T-cell (CAR-T) therapy that targets CD19 and B-cell maturation antigen (BCMA). The study will include 15 subjects to receive Fast Dual CAR-T single infusion.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of AE after Fast Dual CAR-T infusion
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 24 weeks after Fast Dual CAR-T infusion
primary_outcome.description: Incidence of adverse events after Fast Dual CAR-T infusion

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12 weeks, 24 weeks after Fast Dual CAR-T infusion
secondary_outcome.description: Overall response rate (ORR=CR+CRi) after Fast Dual CAR-T infusion

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12 weeks, 24 weeks after Fast Dual CAR-T infusion
secondary_outcome.description: Progression free survival (PFS) after Fast Dual CAR-T infusion

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12 weeks, 24 weeks after Fast Dual CAR-T infusion
secondary_outcome.description: overall survival (OS) after Fast Dual CAR-T infusion

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Days 4, 7, 10, 14 and weeks 4, 8, 12, 18, 24 after Fast Dual CAR-T infusion
secondary_outcome.description: CAR Copies measured by qPCR after Fast Dual CAR-T infusion

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Days 4, 7, 10, 14 and weeks 4, 8, 12, 18, 24 after Fast Dual CAR-T infusion
secondary_outcome.description: CAR-T cell counts measured by Flow cytometry after Fast Dual CAR-T infusion

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the concentration of cytokine IL-1, IL-2, IL-6, IL-10, TNF-α and IFN-γ.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Days 4, 7, 10, 14 and 28 after Fast Dual CAR-T infusion
secondary_outcome.description: Cytokines in serum measured by ELISA after Fast Dual CAR-T infusion

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Weeks 4, 12, 24 after Fast Dual CAR-T infusion
secondary_outcome.description: Replication competent lentivirus (RCL) in blood after Fast Dual CAR-T infusion

arm_group.description: CD19+ R/R B-NHL patients be treated with a single dose of Fast Dual CAR-T cells. Total dose of (1-5)*10E5/kg cells will be administered at Day 0.

intervention.description: Fast Dual CAR-T injection is a autologous dual CAR-T targeted CD19 and BCMA. A single infusion of CART cells will be administered intravenously.

overall_official.affiliation: 920th Hospital of Joint Logistics Support Force of People's Liberation Army of China
